etymologies: mid 16th century: from Spanish flamengo, earlier form of flamenco (see flamenco); associated, because of its color, with Latin flamma ‘a flame’

definitions: a tall wading bird with mainly pink or scarlet plumage and long legs and neck. It has a heavy bent bill that is held upside down in the water in order to filter-feed on small organisms.

notes.text: Family Phoenicopteridae: three genera and four species, in particular the greater flamingo (Phoenicopterus ruber)

shortDefinitions: tall wading bird with mainly pink or scarlet plumage and long legs and neck
